page.title: 07THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall is where Glenprosen School Children and teacher go every day. We go there at half past twelve for lunch. We go to the hall for dinner because we do not have a dinner room at the school. The hall is also used by the school on Thursday afternoons for gym. The community use the hall occassionally for ceilidhs, parties and whist drives. The hall is swept by Mrs. Riddell (the retired roadman's wife) who also serves as dinner lady and cleaner for school. The hall is 6m wide and 16m long. It has 11 windows and 2 doors, one front and one back. We use the back door to come in for our dinner. It has a small kitchen and male and female toilets. Without the village hall social life in Glenprosen would stop.
